title: I’m very interested in Native American culture (hunting, music, and traits) and history. Are there any recommended great books? - Quora
tags: Culture of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I’ve always found the story of Chief Joseph and the Nez Perce Indians attempt to flee to Canada after yet another treaty was broken to be fascinating and beyond tragic. Here is a book I found that seems to be a nice treatment of the subject: Amazon.com: Chief Joseph & the Flight of the Nez Perce: The Untold Story of an American Tragedy eBook: Kent Nerburn: Kindle Store I am going to put it on my reader (Kindle Unlimited perk) and will take a look at it myself.

Yes: Gwinne -‘Empire of the Summer Moon’. And Cremony- ‘’Life Among the Apaches’ There are literally hundreds of books under various Indian and tribal names. watch the old ‘Stagecoach’ with JohnWayne in it. The Indians in it are from Four Corners and are Navajos. They do a lot of amazing riding.  Quanah Parker died 1911
